channel.title: Sam's Blog
channel.description: Sam's Random collection notes about stuff he is working on.

item.title: Market Sell high
item.description:
Can we do better than just holding onto the SP 500?

Lets say we buy S&P 500 at market open price, and hold it for . What is the maximum return that we could have sold the S&P 500 for during this time. More to the point if we set a sell price would have it sold?

The way I look at this graph is if I old onto the S&P 500 for 1 month I am 20% chance of a 2% increase if I set a sell price at 2% higher then what I buy it for.

Data used was stock symbol VOO, from 2000 to July 2016.

item.title: Market Overview
item.description:
Im starting to learn about investing in the market, and wanted to get a feel for what is possible in the market using simple trades. Also wanted to play around with jekyll and D3 plots.

  • Question 1. What if I put my money into the S&P 500 and then take it out after .

A more in-depth look at this has been done on reddit.

Data from 2000 to 2017 was used for this analysis. After 1 year between 0 and 30% increase in your holdings can be expected. A 1 month holding can expect to hold -2 to 5 % increase in your holdings.

An increase per day of .05 % increase per day if you have 30% increase in a year.

Note CDâ€™s can be expected to return 1 to 1.5% increase.
